medical_history.chief_complaint: Skin eruptions including deep red subcutaneous masses and annular papular lesions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Erythematous deep nodules of the legs occurred for the first time 20 years ago while still living in Italy. The patient experienced symmetric red nodular eruptions of the lower legs shortly after arriving in New York, lasting for 1 month. In 1985, found a sore, painful nodule on left thigh with subsequent recurrence of red lesions leading to scarring. Occasional tender red nodules have continued to form on extremities, healing spontaneously over time. Annular lesions did not recur.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic, inadequately treated tuberculosis diagnosed in 1974 with a positive tuberculin skin test. History of elevated liver function tests leading to a diagnosis of cirrhosis and hepatitis C eight years ago. Always anemic and diagnosed with thalassemia.
medical_history.family_history: Husband died of hepatitis. No other relevant family medical history mentioned.
